Posts.Content: Hi Violet Blue ..Good for you Lady get it out of your system. You've had a horrible time. I hope you're feeling better today & things get better for you. Stay strong xxx
Posts.Title: Big old rant!

Posts.Content: Hi guys I just can't stop crying these past few days  I have no right to feel this down. Unlike most of you I didn't need treatment. I lost my breast but the cancer didn't spread so why I'm I feeling like a complete failure. Is it the  hormones ..I don't sleep and the sweats are driving me insane still having sickness off an on but I've been holding it together until now. I only have my husband who's been my rock. I can't  talk to family their all so busy with there own lives and aren't really interested they never even came to see me in hospital.  Can't tell friends cos they all think I'm great an so brave ..Am I just dwelling in self pity..I feel lost is this normal I mean have you guys felt like this .thanks
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Thanks grannymush37 my breast nurse asked me 2 weeks ago if I needed someone to talk to an i said no..I just can't believe I'm like this it's just not me. I going to a macmillan coffee day tomorrow so perhaps I should ask them about speaking with someone. I know I'm so lucky not to have had treatment when I read some stories on here I feel so ashamed to feel this way...thank you for your kind words of support x
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: What would we do without our men. Went to Macmillan today for a chat and it helped . This site has been wonderful just knowing these feelings are normal has helped in its self..Are our families selfish or can they not cope with it... my husband says selfish and I think he's right... thank you xxx
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Thanks Debs you made me smile.  I had a knee op as well last year for a rare disease and was so thankful when they told me it can be cancerous an mine wasn't only to get hit with breast cancer a year later. I'll look into heart.com any help with sleeping would be great ..thanks for the smile xx
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Ah no hun I'm so sorry.. I can't imagine how low you must be feeling especially after what you have  already been through an losing your Mum. You beat it once you'll do it again and your Mum will be with you the whole time you gotta believe that. Thinking of you big hug xxx
Posts.Title: Hi I am so so sad today my breast cancer is back

Posts.Content: That's it i thought I'm being so selfish feeling like this but all you guys are helping me realise it's normal. Like after shocks  after a earthquake it's only hitting me now..Thanks for your support xxx
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Thanks Lilythepig I went to Macmillan today and their arranging for me to speak to someone.  It's just so new to me needing support normally I'm the one who gives it. I think tiredness isn't helping either I just can't sleep.. I  got bach flower remedy today  so I hope it helps. I realise from reading  all the replies that  I've been hard on myself without knowing it. Thanks again the support is really appreciated xxx
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Hi Eligranny  No no hobbies but I have started to try baking. I'm going out more i go a walk every day which is really good for me as i have  fibromyalgia an use a wheelchair a lot.  I'm going to try some course at Macmillan.  Thankyou for your reply I hope your temperature is nothing serious take care xxx
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Thanks Coastal-lady I went to Macmillan today for a coffee and a chat and it really helped. There  arranging for me to chat with someone who had DCIS as I've had no interaction with anyone face to face who's been through it. So glad I went thankyou for your kind words it means a lot xxx
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Sounds like a good plan. I'm sure the hubby will pitch in when you explain how you feel  good luck i hope it works out.. I'm here when you want to vent.. I'm having a better day thanks been busy baking even tho I'm bloody awful at it but my father in law love my cookies he's got no taste buds lol  big hug xxx
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Thanks Linn.. funny i only heard about post dramatic stress disorder after cancer yesterday. One of the Macmillan support staff said she thought I was suffering from it. It would be lovely to go away but I'm having awful sweats day an night the water just pours down my face an body I can't imagine going abroad like this. My surgeon started my on medication for them but so far they haven't helped. It's not helping me with feeling down i can't put my hair down an had your grow out my fringe I just don't feel like me anymore and I keep telling myself it's only hair and I'm lucky I have it but I'm a real hair and makeup kind of girl. I can't even go out for night because my clothes be soaked through in an hour. Been out one evening in 21 wks an it was a disaster water was running of my face and body. I've started Bach flower remedies for stress like you I'm not keen on antidepressants. This site has been a real lifeline thankyou for sharing with me it helps to know others have been there xx
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: I'm glad you are having a moan sounds like you to entitled to..my husband just about did everything for months and still helps alot he hoovers, mops an cooks when he can. I've been lucky I had a friend staying with me as well for the first 6 wks her an my husband have been amazing.  I'm sorry your daughter choose  to move out the timing's awful but i don't think kids truly get it but your hubby should pitch in more. It could be he just hasn't thought you need help maybe a sit down with him and explain that you might need a little help around the house when you return to work might go along way.  Thanks for your thoughts I'm sending mine back at ya xxx
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Oh yours sound so much more appealing xxx
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: I was on Anastrozole but they paused it because it was making the symptoms extreme. They said my hormones are in over drive from stopping HRT an losing my breast. It throwing me into the change of live very hard and they're trying to get it under control. I've tried acupuncture an reflexology but nothing helping.
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Thanks Islandgirl58. They stopped the Anastrozole to see if the symptoms would ease because they were even more extreme than they are now. I told the breast Care nurse 2wks ago I was fine but I arranged with Action Cancer yesterday to speak with someone because like you i found just speaking to her helped an i had a lot to say. So I'm hopeful it'll help thanks  for the advice I appreciate it xx
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Hi NikkiS I had a mastectomy in January 17 . I was 48 an got reconstruction an a breast reduction.  I got an implant with mesh and went from a 36G to 36C. I'm happy with my decision as new boobs look great. I am finding it hard to get used to the feeling of the implant but I'm confident it'll pass.
Posts.Title: Advice Please....Reconstruction or Not??

Posts.Content: I had surgery 9 weeks ago a mastectomy of the right breast, reconstruction surgery & breast reduction on the left breast. I'm felt great after op then 2 weeks in felt really sick. I though it was the hormone table but i stopped it &  i still felt sick. It lasted about 3 weeks then went away but it's back again i feel so nauseous.  Did anyone else have sickness following surgery? The breast care nurses don't know what could be causing it.  Add tags
Posts.Title: anyone else sick after surgery

Posts.Content: Thanks Debbie  I've booked to see her on Thursday it's the 2nd time I'm sick in just a matter of weeks..
Posts.Title: anyone else sick after surgery

Posts.Content: Thanks Caroline I've checked with my team they said to see my own GP
Posts.Title: anyone else sick after surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Tiger777 I'm 48 an had a mastectomy in the right breast in January I had DCIS. I was also a 36G but my surgeon wouldn't go any larger then a B or C or so he said, I don't know if it's different here in Northern Ireland but they said they wouldn't do any bigger. I also had a breast reduction to balance me out an got an implant as I wanted back on my feet as soon as possible. I've now  been sized a 36D so larger then expected an I'm happy with the size . It's very difficult time and hard to make all these decisions I'm sorry I didn't know about this forum before my surgery i was in a trance the whole time
Posts.Title: Advice on surgery

Posts.Content: Thanks Rainbow Debs I'd heard about course an was considering it . I'll diffenitly check it out xxx
Posts.Title: HOPE COURSE !

Posts.Content: Thanks so much  Jo I will xxx
Posts.Title: HOPE COURSE !

Posts.Content: Hi Jo I'm in Belfast as well and was wondering if there are any hope courses xx
Posts.Title: HOPE COURSE !

Posts.Content: Hi Sharmer I'm sure you are shell shocked it's a terrible blow. I had a mustactomey on the right breast  with reconstructive surgery and a left breast reduction  in January I'm 48 well 49 in a few weeks but still like saying 48. I went to Action Cancer for scan even tho I'd no problems I was dumbfounded when I was told. I agree with grannymush take someone with you and stay away from the Internet. At my first appointment I didn't hear anything they said . Just remember your not alone we've all done this dance and we're all still here.. good luck at your appointment let us know how it goes. .big hug xx
Posts.Title: ... started my journey today

Posts.Content: Hi I'm in the same boat. I was having flushes an sweats every 20 mins so I bought the Lady Care Magnet. 1 week in its helped a bit. Sweats seem to be reduced to  nearly an hour apart. There available at boots
Posts.Title: Can't have HRT so what now?

Posts.Content: Hi ambertiger, welcome . Sound like you could be having a reaction to your dressings, ring your breast Care nurse she can advise you.  Hope you get sorted xxx
Posts.Title: Post surgery advice
